page.title: 15RELIGION
page.content: {Saint James the Great} The church was built in Norman times. It has an old Norman door way. There is also a Norman door way leading out to the grave yard. Inside the church there are two Saxon coffins. There are some old stained glass windows. On the floor near the altar there are several fine brasses of old Hanney families. {Saint James the Less} Saint James the less was an old church in East Hanney, but two years ago it was sold and converted into a house. The grave stones are still around the garden. {The Mission} The mission in East Hanney is a free evangelical church. They have services on Sunday's, Sunday school, and a Tuesday club. In the summer holidays they are running a bible club.
